question.text: Let ∈ 0 denote the dimensional formula of the permittivity of vacuum. If M = mass, L = length, T = time and A = electric current, then :

options.text: <math> <mrow> <mfenced close="]" open="[" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mo>∈</mo> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfenced close="]" open="[" separators=","> <mrow> <msup> <mtext>M</mtext> <mn>-1</mn> </msup> <msup> <mtext> L</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <msup> <mtext> T</mtext> <mn>-1</mn> </msup> <msup> <mtext> A</mtext> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </math>

<math> <mrow> <mfenced close="]" open="[" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mo>∈</mo> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfenced close="]" open="[" separators=","> <mrow> <msup> <mtext>M</mtext> <mn>-1</mn> </msup> <msup> <mtext> L</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <msup> <mtext> T</mtext> <mn>-1</mn> </msup> <mtext> A</mtext> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </math>

<math> <mrow> <mfenced close="]" open="[" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mo>∈</mo> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfenced close="]" open="[" separators=","> <mrow> <msup> <mtext>M</mtext> <mn>-1</mn> </msup> <msup> <mtext> L</mtext> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msup> <msup> <mtext> T</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mtext> A</mtext> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </math>

<math> <mrow> <mfenced close="]" open="[" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mo>∈</mo> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfenced close="]" open="[" separators=","> <mrow> <msup> <mtext>M</mtext> <mn>-1</mn> </msup> <msup> <mtext> L</mtext> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msup> <msup> <mtext> T</mtext> <mn>4</mn> </msup> <msup> <mtext> A</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </math>

solution.text:
F = 1 4 π ε 0 q 1 q 2 R 2

ε 0 = q 1 q 2 4 π FR 2

Hence, ε 0 = C 2 N . m 2 = AT 2 ML T - 2 . L 2 = M -1  L - 3  T 4  A 2
